comments.body:
Maybe this would make the decorator more generalizable:

```
if 'confirmed' in request.args and request.args.get('confirmed') != "true":
    [skipp]
```
Doesn't work in practice since for unconfirmed it just has nothing. (and not confirmed=false)
should this line be `inspect.getsource(x) if x is not None else ''`? For your .jira description, the issue happens when None passes to render function which causes exception?
The behavior is correct either way: `PythonLexer` can handle `None`, but `inspect.getsource`. can't. The unit tests make sure that this is the case.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +356,360 @@        'doc_md': wrapped_markdown,
        'python_callable': lambda x: render(
            inspect.getsource(x) if x is not None else None, lexers.PythonLexer),
    }
